mods.abstract: Female adult, flesh toned, pink luster china shoulder head on cloth body, cloth arms and limbs, molded and painted features, black hair, blue eyes, jointed at shoulders, elbows, hips, and knees, black flat sole shoes, lace trimmed white underwear, lace under-skirt, black velvet bodice with white lace collar, lace ruffle on sleeves, cream satin full length gathered skirt with vertical lace decoration on front panel, horizontal lace decoration on lower part of skirt, black ribbon on back. Accompanying information describes that one of the first dolls made in the United States is the Jennie Lind Doll. Jennie Lind, the actress, had sandy blonde hair. Since she preferred dark hair, she usually wore a black wig on stage. The shoes are the original ones. Jennie Lind came to the United States in 1850. Doll body is hand and machine -made. Dress is machine-made.""
mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Transformed into MODS from extended Dublin Core by the LDL Development Team at Louisiana State University.
